channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 战争正在进入一个不可预测的新阶段。暴力程度可能会减弱，但也有可能爆发并扩大到约旦河西岸和更广泛的地区👇。
item.description:
The war is entering an unpredictable new phase. The level of violence could subside, but there are scenarios in which it might flare up and expand to the West Bank and the wider region https://t.co/Upl743HWr5 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 获取 "隐性知识"--源于经验的诀窍--是一项艰巨的任务。这些知识不容易记录在手册中，掌握这些知识的人也不太重视。这就是如何解决了解你的同事知道什么的问题👇。
item.description:
Capturing “tacit knowledge”—the know-how born of experience—is a tough task. It cannot easily be documented in the manuals and is not much thought about by those who have it. 

This is how to solve the problem of knowing what your co-workers know https://t.co/vAlBK9fGPH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 坦桑尼亚总统萨米亚-苏卢胡-哈桑（Samia Suluhu Hassan）无疑比她惨不忍睹的前任有了进步。然而，她就任总统三年来，言辞未能转化为行动，改革停滞不前，人们对约翰-马古富力（John Magufuli）时代的怀念与日俱增。
item.description:
Tanzania’s president, Samia Suluhu Hassan, is undoubtedly an improvement on her ghastly predecessor.

Yet three years into her presidency, as words fail to translate into action and reforms stall, nostalgia for the John Magufuli era is growing https://t.co/NXNX3CDfJN 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 肥胖薪酬差距比以前想象的还要严重。男女都会受到影响，受过良好教育的人受影响更大
item.description:
The obesity pay gap is worse than previously thought. It affects men as well as women, and is wider for the well-educated https://t.co/5uPAtcRFLW

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 土耳其电视正在蓬勃发展。电视剧正在帮助提升土耳其的形象，尤其是在前奥斯曼帝国的土地上👇。
item.description:
Turkish television is booming. Dramas are helping to boost the country’s im­age, especially in former Ottoman lands https://t.co/wLDp70gNCL 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 政治舞台的编排表明，习近平越来越不愿意与他钦点的下属分享权力。中国的经济战略越是缺乏说服力，中国领导人就越是要加强控制👇。
item.description:
Political choreography suggests that Xi Jinping is growing ever-less willing to share power even with his hand-picked subordinates. The less convincing China’s economic strategy becomes, the more the country’s leader seeks to assert control https://t.co/sspmajDwr4 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，天文学家已经能够测量暗物质的行为，并能指出天空中暗物质一定存在的地方。但它究竟是什么，这仍然是个谜。新的理论可以提供线索： 👇
item.description:
For decades astronomers have been able to measure how dark matter behaves and can point to parts of the sky where it must exist. But what it actually is—that remains a mystery.

New theories could yield clues: https://t.co/0rkhBUmJAG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 政府影响了大量的文学作品。其中有些还很不错。以下是六本你不知道的宣传书籍👇。
item.description:
Governments influence a surprising amount of literature. Some of it pretty good. Here are six books you didn’t know were propaganda https://t.co/dFAE2XxMHk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 印度的政治家和政策制定者对本国面临的肥胖症流行问题迟迟没有觉醒。但他们终于开始采取行动 👇
item.description:
Indian politicians and policymakers have been slow to wake up to the obesity epidemic their country is confronting. But they are at last starting to take action https://t.co/3LxKQc6R1j 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 欧洲最昂贵的城市也是世界上最昂贵的城市，与新加坡并列 👇
item.description:
The most expensive city in Europe is also the most expensive in the world—tied with Singapore https://t.co/7Xt8foAA5L 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 我们的国防编辑挑选了五本书，帮助您了解当今战争是如何进行的 👇
item.description:
Our defence editor picks five books that help make sense of how wars are fought today https://t.co/lDsV8LyIsT 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 它们本来是用来治疗糖尿病的。新一代减肥药的其他益处是意外发现的 👇
item.description:
They were intended to treat diabetes. The other benefits of a new generation of weight-loss drugs were discovered by accident https://t.co/cFNVDPPKM5 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 更好地了解以色列-巴勒斯坦冲突历史的阅读清单 👇
item.description:
A reading list to better understand the history of the Israel-Palestine conflict https://t.co/M6eNg5vusv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 五篇介绍如何简单而出色地写作的文章 👇
item.description:
Five texts that explain how to write simply and well https://t.co/11GqyynkYE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 向初学经济学的人推荐五本书 👇
item.description:
Five recommended books for those starting to study economics https://t.co/fEbNcnsutk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 多年来，美国的新购房者一直享受着比租房者更低的房价。但如今，买房和租房之间的选择看起来大不相同。阅读原因 👇
item.description:
For years new home-buyers in America have enjoyed lower housing payments than renters. But today the choice between buying and renting looks very different. Read why https://t.co/IBACTXNvgH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 只是没有那么充实 👇
item.description:
It is just not that fulfilling https://t.co/fRTmmVKbRD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 有关东北锈带的故事在中国引起了强烈反响。或许是因为政府多年来也公开谈论过该地区的停滞不前，审查人员对这些故事置之不理 👇。
item.description:
Stories about the Dongbei rust belt are resonant in China. Censors have left them alone, perhaps because the gov­ernment has also talked publicly for years about the region’s stagnation https://t.co/2NB5nKjoke 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 寻找下一本读物？这九本近期出版的历史类图书是该类型图书中的佼佼者👇。
item.description:
Looking for your next read? These nine recent books on history are some of the best the genre has to offer https://t.co/gZZe2dodvZ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 越南儿童的教育体系是世界上最好的教育体系之一。这对经济也有帮助👇。
item.description:
Vietnamese children go through one of the best schooling systems in the world. That has helped the economy too https://t.co/GzgiGQbv6p 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 为什么人过中年，越老越快乐 👇
item.description:
Why, beyond middle age, people get happier as they get older https://t.co/Ad1wknZW0r 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰战争可能会给东亚和平带来毁灭性后果。如果拒绝向北约提供安全保证的唐纳德-特朗普成为美国的下一任总统，这对美国的亚洲盟友意味着什么？ 👇
item.description:
The war in Ukraine could have devastating consequences for peace in East Asia. If Donald Trump, who has repudiated security guarantees to NATO, becomes America’s next president, what will that mean for the country’s Asian allies? https://t.co/cbKlOh47Tr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 一项新研究发现，具有某种基因突变的拉布拉多犬可能更倾向于在两餐之间寻找食物，从而导致它们发胖 🐶
item.description:
Labradors with a certain gene mutation may be more inclined to seek out food in between meals, causing them to put on the pounds, a new study has found https://t.co/ZXasAe8MVw 🐶

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 对于生产商来说，健脑物质的吸引力既在于不断增长的需求，也在于可以方便地将保健品投放市场 Many Rivers Prods/Kobal/Shutterstock
item.description:
To manufacturers, the appeal of brain-boosting substances lies both in growing demand and in the ease with which supplements can be put on the market https://t.co/OQwOzoHv2V

Image: Many Rivers Prods/Kobal/Shutterstock pic.twitter.com/8DRV8UfPq2

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 第三方会对美国大选产生什么影响？请收听由 @JohnPrideaux、@chowardchoward 和 @imkahloon 主持的 "制衡 "节目： 🎧
item.description:
What impact could third parties have on America’s election? Listen to “Checks and Balance”, with @JohnPrideaux, @chowardchoward and @imkahloon: https://t.co/r31cnQ9FpW 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 晚婚、更努力地工作和更好地为人父母减少了男性的友谊。美国男性比其他地方的男性更孤独👇。
item.description:
Marrying later, working harder and being better parents have diminished male friendships. Men are lonelier in America than elsewhere https://t.co/Xqxm7OKxQC 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 美国比任何其他大国都更依赖汽车，平均每个家庭拥有两辆汽车。这反过来又与许多弊端联系在一起，但也有一些令人惊讶的好处 👇
item.description:
America is far more car-reliant than any other big country, averaging roughly two vehicles per household. This, in turn, is linked to many ills—but there are also some surprising benefits https://t.co/qMInvIh4H7 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 近 70% 的美国成年人超重，超过三分之一的人肥胖。 但美国也有健康美食--只要你知道去哪里找 👇
item.description:
Nearly 70% of American adults are overweight; over a third are obese.⁠ But America has healthy cuisines—if you know where to look https://t.co/Oh5EgkmwsQ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 近几十年来，全球价值观发生了重大转变，而且是非同寻常的转变。探索我们的互动平台，了解它是什么👇。
item.description:
In recent decades there has been a substantial shift in global values—and an extraordinary one. Explore our interactive to discover what it is https://t.co/QnLNIzRPEu 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 摄入更少的卡路里可以防止衰老 👇
item.description:
Eating fewer calories can ward off ageing https://t.co/wPEr09zuLA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024
